intro: Oligomeris subulata, commonly known as the slender-leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves. The plant attaches itself to host trees, primarily in the genus *Ficus*, through specialized roots called haustoria. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers and red berries that are dispersed by birds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant parasitism and ecological interactions.
